trans-unit.source: Assign variables in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Assign variables in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for assigning Transact-SQL variables in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for assigning Transact-SQL variables in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Assign variables in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Assign variables in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: Variables in SQL Data Warehouse are set using the `DECLARE` statement or the `SET` statement.
trans-unit.target: Variables in SQL Data Warehouse are set using the `DECLARE` statement or the `SET` statement.

trans-unit.source: All of the following are perfectly valid ways to set a variable value:
trans-unit.target: All of the following are perfectly valid ways to set a variable value:

trans-unit.source: Setting variables with DECLARE
trans-unit.target: Setting variables with DECLARE

trans-unit.source: Initializing variables with DECLARE is one of the most flexible ways to set a variable value in SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Initializing variables with DECLARE is one of the most flexible ways to set a variable value in SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: You can also use DECLARE to set more than one variable at a time.
trans-unit.target: You can also use DECLARE to set more than one variable at a time.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use `SELECT` or `UPDATE` to do this:
trans-unit.target: You cannot use `SELECT` or `UPDATE` to do this:

trans-unit.source: You cannot initialise and use a variable in the same DECLARE statement.
trans-unit.target: You cannot initialise and use a variable in the same DECLARE statement.

trans-unit.source: To illustrate the point the example below is **not** allowed as @p1 is both initialized and used in the same DECLARE statement.
trans-unit.target: To illustrate the point the example below is **not** allowed as @p1 is both initialized and used in the same DECLARE statement.

trans-unit.source: This will result in an error.
trans-unit.target: This will result in an error.

trans-unit.source: Setting values with SET
trans-unit.target: Setting values with SET

trans-unit.source: Set is a very common method for setting a single variable.
trans-unit.target: Set is a very common method for setting a single variable.

trans-unit.source: All of the examples below are valid ways of setting a variable with SET:
trans-unit.target: All of the examples below are valid ways of setting a variable with SET:

trans-unit.source: You can only set one variable at a time with SET.
trans-unit.target: You can only set one variable at a time with SET.

trans-unit.source: However, as can be seen above compound operators are permissable.
trans-unit.target: However, as can be seen above compound operators are permissable.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: You cannot use SELECT or UPDATE for variable assignment.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use SELECT or UPDATE for variable assignment.
